translated:
Matthias Natanael (Natan), lecturer, Växjö, b. 30/5/1898 in Asarum, Blekinge county. Married 1st time in 1927-1933 to Sys Poulsen; 2nd time in 1936 to Lita Walilin. Children: Jan, born in 1929, Lena in 1936, Klas in 1937, Stefan in 1944. — B.A. in Lund in 1921, M.A. in 1922, Ph.Lic. in 1928, Ph.D. in 1930, promoted in 1931. Worked as assistant in Asine excavations from 1924-1926, member of École française d'Athènes from 1925-1927, secretary at the Swedish institute in Rome in 1927, student at the University of Copenhagen from 1929-1930, led own excavations in Messenia in Greece from 1926-1937, studied abroad in Greece, Italy, Yugoslavia, Albania, Egypt, Palestine, Syria, Germany, Austria, Hungary, France, and the Netherlands from 1924-1947. Docent at Lund University from 1930-1940, temporary professor there from 1930-1932 and 1936-1940, at Gothenburg University in 1932 and 1936, lecturer in Hudiksvall from 1940-1945, in other places temporarily as professor in Lund from 1939, lecturer at the higher education institution in Växjö from 1945. Built and organized the museum in Vasiliko in Greece from 1933-1935. Chairman of the faculty literature association in Lund from 1930-1936, initiated the Home Guard in Skåne in 1940, chairman of the Hudiksvall Home Guard Association from 1940-1945, started the humanities association in Hudiksvall in 1943, secretary from 1943-1945, member of the Swedish science society in Lund from 1936, corresponding member of the German Archaeological Institute in 1937, member of the committee for civil institutions in Athens in 1946. Writings: Karlshamn-Asarum (1923), Topographical Studies on Ancient Messenia (1930), Athens in Ancient Times (1931), A la Grecque (1932), Daily Life in Ancient Athens (1934, Danish edition in 1935), Work and Slavery in Antiquity (1937), Modern Greeks (1937), Democracy in Ancient Athens (1939), The Swedish Messenia Expedition (1938), Excavations of Delphi III: VI (teat:inskr. 1939), the Adriatic Area, etc. (1939), Hellenic Horizon (1941), Alexander the Great (1942, Danish edition in 1943), Hannibal (1944, Danish edition in 1946), At the Red Wine Sea (1944), The Doric Problem (1945), Demosthenes (1946), around 20 scientific articles, around 40 popular science journal entries, co-author in the Swedish encyclopedia and in local and international newspapers. Hobbies: landscape painting, stamp collecting. Order of the North Star (1936), Commander First Class of the Order of Vasa (1947), honorary citizen of Vasiliko in Greece (1933), gold plaque for the Home Guard (1942).

Axel Ruben Natanael, dentist, Sölvesborg, b. 8/1/1887 in Hässleholm, son of the locksmith Axel Israel W. and Maria Andersson. Married in 1913 to Jenny Wessiberg. Children: Aino, born in ?, died in ?, Margaretha in 1915, Carl-Gustav in 1917, Carl-Axel in 1918, Börje in 1920, Birgitta in 1922, died in 1929, Gudrun in 1924. — Graduated from Kristianstad Institute in 1906, graduated as a dentist in 1909.Financial assistant from 1906-1908, dentist practitioner in Sölvesborg since 1911, school dentist there from 1929-1944. Board member in the local dental association from 1928-1931, vice chairman from 1931-1936 and chairman from 1936-1946. Member of the municipal board and the board of Sölvesborg Liquor Sales A-B from 1928. Study trip to Germany in 1915.
